comments:
I installed eclipse version F2 (eclipse-SDK-20020502-win32.zip) on a PC running 
win2000.  I then ran eclipse creating a simple 'HelloWorld' application.  I 
then rebooted the machine to win98, and get the following error (eclipse will 
not run):

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Jun 05, 2002 17:57:15.330
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of 
boot plug-in or specify -boot.
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.searchForBoot(Main.java:417)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:387)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:234)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:693)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:526)


I then repeated the procedure by installing eclipse on win98 first.  When I 
then reboot to win2000 everything is fine.  I am able to modify projects in 
both win98 and win2000 with on difficulties in this scenario.

Can you check the casing of the directories where you installed Eclipse? 
Also note the file system type for the drive where you installed Eclipse.
Could be a duplicate of Bug 19046.
Thanks.

With reference to case sensitivity, I used lower case to specify the 
directories when I installed both eclipse and jdk1.3.1 on win2000 (d:\f2_2000 
and d:\jdk1.3.1).  On win2000 both directories appear as expected, all lower 
case.  When I use explorer on win98 the directory for eclipse appears as 
F2_2000, yet the jdk is jdk1.3.1.  The d drive is common between both win98 and 
win2000.  I would not expect case sensitivity issues when running on a windows 
environment.

Does appear to be a duplicate of bug 19046

Note: If jdk/eclipse installed on win98 first there is no issue in going 
between win2000 and win98.

Marking as duplicate.
Agreed that case should be ignored on a case-insensitive file system.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 19046 ***

traces.message: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of  boot plug-in or specify -boot.
